Key Match Events: Wales won 1-0 against Montenegro, with Harry Wilson scoring the only goal of the game
Pre-Game Insights: Wales boss Craig Bellamy was optimistic about his team's chances despite injuries to key players
Montenegro coach Robert Prosinecki was under pressure to get a result to avoid relegation
Post-Match Reflections: Craig Bellamy praised his team's resilience and determination in securing the win
Robert Prosinecki was disappointed with his team's performance and vowed to make changes to avoid relegation
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Cardiff City Stadium, with Wales dominating possession and creating several scoring opportunities
Montenegro struggled to create chances and were ultimately punished for their mistakes
Others: Wales' win keeps them in contention for promotion from League B Group 4, while Montenegro's defeat leaves them in danger of relegation
The match was a crucial one for both teams, with the winner earning three points and the loser dropping two points
